programmes.show_description: Prue is joined by actress Sophie Winkleman, making her a chicken pie using hot-water crust pastry, then prepares an oxtail stew and dumplings served with frozen mashed potato. Meanwhile, her husband John heads out to the garden to catch up with gardener Philippa, and Prue's food hero this time is a northern Chinese restaurant that is making waves in south Wales.
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

Another camera crew arrive on the farm as Liz and Kelvin appear on Lorraine Kelly's show, before they share the good news of Ginger's pregnancy with the children. Kelvin has mixed feelings about the imminent departure of cow Sonic, and a new cockerel arrives on the farm for breeding season
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions
Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Stoke-on-Trent, assessing items including a collection of 500 vinyl records, a painting that has been in the loft for 40 years and a valuable haul of gold sovereigns

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz as Chirag and Krupa, Maia and Wendy, and Abby and David take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis as they attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums. Only one team will make it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh hosts as Gillian from Glasgow, Vanessa from Rochdale, Dean from London and Sanj from Stoke-on-Trent work as a team to take on one of the experts in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
By the Scottish Green Party
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

There is an emergency on the farm when a ewe becomes sick, Kelvin readies the older piglets for market and a visit to A&E is in order after a run-in with a wasp's nest. A kitten becomes the newest member of the household and it is party time as Kelvin pulls out all the stops for a surprise birthday bash for Liz's 40th
Joe wants to seek revenge on Cain, while Aaron reaches out to Bear, and Ross reckons he has a foolproof plan
Mal locks Bernie in the cafe to declare his feelings, Debbie instructs Ronnie to transfer cash to Carl, and Steve hears news of his dad for the first time in years

Jane meets dashing businessman Luis Castillo and the two begin a relationship, but tensions soon erupt on a holiday in Greece and she becomes increasingly unstable. As Jane's carefully constructed composure starts to fracture and puts her position with the duchess at risk, a lifeline appears in the shape of the charismatic Tommy Cressman
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents
Current affairs show tackling the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective, with studio debate and analysis of major stories

The 14 Brits who set off to climb one of New Zealand's highest peaks are down to 10. Having made it to the second base camp, they face a vote-off presided over by host Ben Shephard. As an exhausting snow hike sees the nine remaining climbers tested physically and mentally, call centre worker Sean struggles to keep up, a challenging rope crossing sees influencer Tara forced to find unconventional methods to stay on track, and the Mountain's Keeper sets a dramatic test
News, sport and weather from across Scotland
Natural history meets adrenaline-fuelled entertainment as ocean-phobic celebrities come face-to-face with nature’s most terrifying underwater predators
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions
More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Cirencester, Gloucestershire where a collection of jewellery helps pay for a trip to America and Henry Nicholls can't resist spending more than he wants to for a watch. One of the production team steps in to showcase a vintage dressing gown

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz as Richard and Elliot, Chantal and Isabelle, and Saul and Akash take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis. They attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums, with only one team making it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh hosts as Charles from Basildon, Ruth from Leeds, Pam from Nottingham and Aidan from Coventry work as a team to take on one of the experts in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programmes.show_name: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programmes.show_description: Ahead of tomorrow's Energy Price Cap announcement, Martin shares the crucial information needed to take action when it is confirmed, and also puts viewers' questions to the chief executive of energy regulator Ofgem. Plus, the latest News You Can Use features the best deals of the week
Kim persuades Joe to test Graham's loyalty, while a farm emergency worries Cain

Jodie is tracked down by a girl called Olivia, Bernie threatens to report Mal for breaking into her home, Maggie reminds Lauren who calls the shots, and Steve feels reluctant about visiting his dad in hospital

Nine of the original 14 participants are left as the treacherous terrain and brutal vote-offs claim more victims, and in a dramatic twist the Mountain's Keeper gives one of the group a tough decision to make by choosing someone to leave the mountain. The emotional repercussions of this see everyone beginning to think more strategically, while tensions increase when they are forced to camp in the wild and they start to plot against one another
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents
Current affairs show tackling the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective, with studio debate and analysis of major stories
